Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
Comments_List: The course is a great survey of trends in twentieth century American dance. I feel like I got a great sense of the major choreographers. I also definitely improved my writing; Prof. Seibert conducts writing workshops for each assignment.
So much about the evolution and history of dance as well as how to critically analyse and understand dance itself.
Learned a lot about writing about dance and describing motion through text
The strengths are the sheer amount of material covered and the organization of the course. Seminar time could have been more structured.
Strengths: great learning opportunity to improve writing skills.

I like that we had guest lecturers come in and teach us how to dance. I like that we had feedback on our work. I think the writing workshop process could be better. Since it is a writing class, I think it would also be valuable to deliberately improve on a piece of writing and have to turn in a revised draft to ensure we understand the corrections.

I would recommend it. I feel like I have enough background to go see live dance with a critical eye. And, not only do you learn the history but you learn the craft of writing about dance, which is an interesting exercise.
Only if you are really interested in dance
